  • Field Details

    • freeConnectors

      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.Set<Connector>> freeConnectors

  • Constructor Details

    • ProgramArea

      public ProgramArea​(int[] bounds)

  • Method Details

    • release

      public void release​(Block block)
      Called when a block is released on top of the program area. This function adds the block to the blockList, as well as its free connectors to the freeConnectors list. When this is done, it looks for any nearby compatible connectors. If any are available, it connects the block. Finally, the height of this block (and that of all above it) is updated, as it is possible this block was released in a nestedBlock.
      Parameters:
      block - the dragged block which is now released in this program area.

    • setBlocks

      public void setBlocks​(java.util.ArrayList<Block> newBlocks)
      Replaces the current blocks with another block list. This can be used to revert to a previous state, or to load in an entire program at once.
      Parameters:
      newBlocks - The blocks this program area should replace the current block list with.

    • addBlock

      private void addBlock​(Block block)
      Add block, all its free connectors and all its connected right/lower/body blocks
      Parameters:
      block - the to be added block

    • removeBlock

      private void removeBlock​(Block block)
      Remove block, all its free connectors and all its connected right/lower/body blocks
      Parameters:
      block - the to be removed block

    • removeFunctionCallBlock

      private void removeFunctionCallBlock​(FunctionCallBlock block)
      Removes a given function call block by properly disconnecting it from any blocks above or below it, and connects the top block to the block below if both exist.
      Parameters:
      block - The function call block which should be removed from the entire program area.

    • removeFunctionCallBlocks

      int removeFunctionCallBlocks​(int toRemoveID)
      Removes all function call blocks related to the given ID.
      Parameters:
      toRemoveID - the ID of the call blocks which should be removed
      Returns:
      the amount of blocks which were removed

    • resetProgramArea

      public void resetProgramArea()
      Resets the program area by removing all blocks. This is useful for when we want to load in a new game and clear the current program.

    • startDraggingBlock

      public void startDraggingBlock​(Block block)
      Executes when a block in programArea starts being dragged. We disconnect it from any left or up connections it might have, remove it from the list of blocks and update the height of wrapper blocks if necessary.
      Parameters:
      block - the clicked on block

    • disconnectConnector

      private void disconnectConnector​(Connector c)
      Disconnects a connector with the connector it is currently matched with. The reason ProgramArea manages this method is to ensure the freeConnector list is fully correct.
      Parameters:
      c - The to be disconnected connector

    • tryToConnectBlock

      private void tryToConnectBlock​(Block block)
      Check for every open connector of a block whether a connection can be made. If a connection is possible, we connect the block and remove the connectors from the freeConnector list.
      Parameters:
      block - The block for which we check any compatible nearby connections.

    • addFreeConnectors

      private void addFreeConnectors​(Block block)

    • addFreeConnectors

      private void addFreeConnectors​(java.util.ArrayList<Connector> connectors)

    • removeFreeConnectors

      private void removeFreeConnectors​(Block block)

    • setConnectorHighlight

      public void setConnectorHighlight​(Block block)
      Check for every open connector of a block whether the requirements of a connection are met. If this is the case we highlight this connector and the connector it can connect to.
      Parameters:
      block - the to be checked block

    • getClosestCompatibleConnector

      private Connector getClosestCompatibleConnector​(Connector c1)
      Parameters:
      c1 - the to be checked connector
      Returns:
      the closest compatible connector where distance(c1.getPosition(), closest.getPosition()) <= 15}

    • getFreeConnectors

      public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.Set<Connector>> getFreeConnectors()

    • setFreeConnectors

      public void setFreeConnectors​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.Set<Connector>> newConnectors)

    • updateHeights

      private void updateHeights​(Block startBlock)
      Update the height of all wrapper blocks ConditionBlock to match the amount of blocks in their body. Given startBlock, this function finds the highest block in the same scope, then calculates the height of the scope. Using this height we recursively call this function for the scope above until the heights of all above scopes have been updated.
      Parameters:
      startBlock - The block we start at

    • calculateHeightOfScope

      private int calculateHeightOfScope​(Block startBlock)
      Parameters:
      startBlock - the block we start at
      Returns:
      the sum of heights of startBlock and all the blocks under it

    • distance

      private static double distance​(int[] pos1, int[] pos2)

    • getMatchingDefinitionBlock

      FunctionDefinitionBlock getMatchingDefinitionBlock​(int uniqueID)

    • decrementHigherIDs

      void decrementHigherIDs​(int id)
      Decrement the ids of functionCallBlocks and functionDefinitionBlocks that have a higher id than id
      Parameters:
      id - the id of a block that is about to be removed
